What is the difference between 'not under command' and 'restricted in ability to manoeuvre'?
quiz.truth_answer: Not under command means unable to avoid collision by action of her own; restricted in ability to manoeuvre means that she may be required to take action to avoid collision but cannot do so with certainty.

quiz.question: What sound signal should a power-driven vessel making way through the water sound in restricted visibility?
quiz.truth_answer: One prolonged blast at intervals of not more than 2 minutes

quiz.question: What is the difference between 'not under command' and 'restricted in ability to manoeuvre'?
quiz.truth_answer: Not under command means unable to manoeuvre at will; restricted in ability to manoeuvre means limited by some factor (e.g. draught) but still able to manoeuvre.

quiz.question: What is the stand-on vessel's responsibility in an overtaking situation?
quiz.truth_answer: The stand-on vessel shall keep her course and speed. However, if the give-way vessel fails to take appropriate action, the stand-on vessel may take action alone.
